title: 2019 SAFF U-18 Championship: Gurkirat Singh brace sinks Sri Lanka, India enter semis
text:
India defeated Sri Lanka 3-0 in a Group B clash of the 2019 SAFF (South Asian Football Federation) U-18 Championship at the APF Stadium in Kathmandu, Nepal, on Wednesday afternoon.

Floyd Pinto made five changes to the side that drew 0-0 against Bangladesh. Goalkeeper Lalbiakhlua Jongte started in place of injured Prabhsukhan Singh Gill. Muhammed Rafi, Gurkirat Singh, Jeakson Singh and Ravi Rana were the other changes in the lineup.

Ninthoinganba Meetei's 36th-minute free-kick went inches wide of the left post after the setpiece was won by Vikram Pratap Singh. Vikram was once again brought down outside the box in the 41st minute but Jeakson's resultant free-kick was stopped by the wall.

Sri Lanka India 2019 SAFF U18 Championship More

It didn't take long for India to break the deadlock. Gurkirat took advantage of a failed clearance to chip the ball past the hapless Sri Lanka custodian in the 65th minute.

Sri Lanka failed to garner a response in the tie while Gurkirat and Aman Chetri, who had replaced Givson Singh, scored a goal each in injury time.

In the last four, India and Bangladesh from Group B - both of whom finished with three points and a goal difference of +3 - will face Bhutan and Maldives from Group A. Both the ties will take place on Friday.

India first XI: Lalbiakhlua Jongte (GK), Muhammed Rafi, Jitendra Singh (C), Narender Gahlot, Vikram Pratap Singh, Ninthoinganba Meetei Khumanthem, Givson Singh Moirangthem, Gurkirat Singh, Jeakson Singh Thanoujam, Ravi Bahadur Rana, Moirangthem Thoiba Singh.Moirangthem Thoiba Singh.

Coach: Floyd Pinto.
description: Gurkirat Singh bagged a brace as India cruised into the semi-finals
